channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OK
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OK

item.title: Report E-2024010347
item.description:
Report E-2024010347

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-22T15:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-30
  • City: OKLAHOMA CITY
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported an 8 oz. release of UN3266, Perform XXL Booster due to a puncture caused by a faulty nail inside of a trailer from terminal LDA. The damaged container, a 65-gallon DF, was turned upside down and the release was contained to the top of the drum. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and they felt confident overpacking the damaged drum into an 85-gallon DF and it was left onsite as waste for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024010266
item.description:
Report X-2024010266

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-17T15:11:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-21
  • City: EDMOND
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to QA, leaking. Placed in tote. DescribePack: Outer package contains the canned product inside its manufactured packaging, surrounded with paper. Cans have loose lids, are dented, and are spilling contents possibly due to no paint clips. Outer packaging does not have a diamond or fragile liquid transport label. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in tote.
